question: Match the following (Gymnosperm spores & cones):
matches: Spore type in gymnosperms – Heterosporous
Location of spore formation – Within sporangia
Male cones in gymnosperms – Microsporangiate or male strobili
Female cones in gymnosperms – Macrosporangiate or female strobili
Arrangement of sporophylls – Spirally along an axis
answer: Spore type in gymnosperms – Heterosporous, Location of spore formation – Within sporangia, Male cones in gymnosperms – Microsporangiate or male strobili, Female cones in gymnosperms – Macrosporangiate or female strobili, Arrangement of sporophylls – Spirally along an axis

question: Match the following (Gymnosperm pollen & cones):
matches: Pollen grain development site – Microsporangia
Male gametophyte in gymnosperms – Highly reduced gametophyte
Cones on same tree – Pinus
Cones on different trees – Cycas
Female cones in gymnosperms – Megasporophylls may be clustered
answer: Pollen grain development site – Microsporangia, Male gametophyte in gymnosperms – Highly reduced gametophyte, Cones on same tree – Pinus, Cones on different trees – Cycas, Female cones in gymnosperms – Megasporophylls may be clustered

question: Match the following (Gymnosperm female gametophyte & ovule):
matches: Megaspore mother cell forms – Four megaspores
Ovule structure components – Nucellus + envelopes
Gametes in female gametophyte – Two or more archegonia
Site of female gametophyte development – Within the megasporangium
Retention of female gametophyte – Retained within megasporangium
answer: Megaspore mother cell forms – Four megaspores, Ovule structure components – Nucellus + envelopes, Gametes in female gametophyte – Two or more archegonia, Site of female gametophyte development – Within the megasporangium, Retention of female gametophyte – Retained within megasporangium

question: Match the following (Gymnosperm gametophyte & fertilisation):
column_I: Fate of pollen grain after release
column_II: Within sporangia retained on the sporophytes
Pollen tube carrying male gametes grows towards archegonia
matches: Independent gametophyte phase in gymnosperms – Not independent free-living
Fate of pollen grain after release – Carried in air currents
Gametophyte location – Within sporangia retained on the sporophytes
Fertilisation delivery method – Pollen tube carrying male gametes grows towards archegonia
Post-fertilisation changes – Zygote → embryo, ovules → seeds
answer: Independent gametophyte phase in gymnosperms – Not independent free-living, Fate of pollen grain after release – Carried in air currents, Gametophyte location – Within sporangia retained on the sporophytes, Fertilisation delivery method – Pollen tube carrying male gametes grows towards archegonia, Post-fertilisation changes – Zygote → embryo, ovules → seeds

question: Match the following (Gymnosperm fertilisation & seeds):
column_II: Near the mouth of the archegonia
matches: Pollen grain release site – Microsporangium
Target of pollen tube – Archegonia in the ovules
Seed covering in gymnosperms – Not covered
Fertilisation location – Near the mouth of the archegonia
Fertilisation product – Embryo
answer: Pollen grain release site – Microsporangium, Target of pollen tube – Archegonia in the ovules, Seed covering in gymnosperms – Not covered, Fertilisation location – Near the mouth of the archegonia, Fertilisation product – Embryo
